annotations.description: The fans in the stadium certainly won't regret buying tickets as they witnessed a great game today. The away side dominated the game. The home team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence mostly using rapid counter attacks. On the other hand, long balls and crosses were the main weapons of the away team.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) outjumps the defenders inside the six yard box to meet the corner and scores with a header into the middle of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:2.

gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the box but his shot is blocked.

Graziano Pelle (Southampton) found himself in a promising position. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper was ready and made a decent save.
Oscar (Chelsea) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Fraser Forster was alert and the score remains the same.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) times his run too early and the linesman raises his flag for offside.
Willian (Chelsea) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Brilliant finish! Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Diego Costa, then produced a nice strike into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:1.
Martin Atkinson blows his whistle and it's Willian (Chelsea) who is penalised for an offensive foul. Good decision by the referee.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away.

Matt Targett (Southampton) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.
John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) covers his face with his hands after wasting a glorious chance. The ball rebounded to him but his close range header went a whisker wide of the left post.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The game restarts for the second half.

Both sides have been very active in the first half, providing the fans with an exciting show. The game is quite balanced. The home side is creating their opportunities using lightning fast counter attacks. The tactic of the away side is slow build up play.

annotations.label: whistle

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Shane Long (Southampton), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 1:0.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar.

A through ball from John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) fails to reach Eden Hazard as one of the defending players reacts brilliantly to intercept the effort. If the pass had been produced a little bit earlier, Eden Hazard could have got into a promising position.
Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) attempted to create a dangerous situation in front of goal by sending a cross into the box, but the defence easily dealt with the threat.

Some great controlled play and passing in the middle of the pitch from Chelsea.

Diego Costa (Chelsea) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) swings in a cross, but the ball is cleared to safety by one of the defending players.

annotations.description: Steven Davis (Southampton) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Martin Atkinson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

annotations.label: lineup1
annotations.description: Both teams starting lineups are available now, so you can have a look at them.
Hello, welcome to our live play by play commentaries. You will be able to see a written form of all the interesting moments of the game, so you won't miss a thing. Sit back and have fun.

The fans in the stadium certainly won't regret buying tickets as they witnessed a great game today. The away side dominated the game. The home team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence mostly using rapid counter attacks. On the other hand, long balls and crosses were the main weapons of the away team.
